title: About
text:
This is a simple test site to play around with webr 0.2.0, the r version that runs with web assembly inside the browser.
I wanted to check how difficult it would be to load a csv file from a remote location (github didnâ€™t cause CORS errorsa) to the local, virtual file system, the plot with `ggplot.

title: About
text:
References

webr 0.2.0 blog post
webr website
webr extension for quarto

title: web
text:
The following is a vanilla r piece of code, in which we download a csv file to local directory, then process, produce a ggplot image which when gets include


Code
library(tidyverse)
url <- "https://storage.googleapis.com/dft-statistics/road-traffic/downloads/traffic/vehicle-type/region_id/dft_traffic_vehicle_type_region_id_7.csv"
t <- read_csv(url)

t %>% 
  mutate(pedal_cycles_k = pedal_cycles/1000) %>% 
  ggplot(aes(x = year, y = pedal_cycles_k )) + 
  geom_line() +
  theme_minimal()
